question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 2 \\ 
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\ 
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $(5,3,3)$ as unique solution.
answer3: The system has $(10,5,6)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The system has $(\frac{5}{3}z,1+\frac{2}{3}z,z)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x_1 &- &x_2 &- &3x_3 &+ &4x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &x_2 &+ &x_3 &+ &2x_4 &= &-1 \\
& &- &x_2 &- &2x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &1 \\
&x_1 &+ &2x_2 &+ &3x_3 &+ &x_4 &= &-2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$(x_3-3x_4,-1-2x_3+x_4, x_3, x_4), \, \forall x_3,x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$
answer3:
The system has many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(1-3x_4,-1+x_4, 1, x_4), \, \forall x_4\in\mathbb{R}$$.

question: Solve the constraint optimization problem $f\left(x,y\right)=x+2y$ subject to $x^2+y^2=4$.
answer1: It has $1$ local maximum and $1$ local minimum.
answer2: It has $2$ local maximum and $2$ local minimum.
answer4: It has an infinit number of solutions.

Consider the linear operator $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $F(x,y)=(x+2y,2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$

question:
How many solutions the following linear system has?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccccc}
2x & + & y &  &  & - & w & = & 1\\
2x & - & y & + & z & - & 2w & = & 2\\
x & + & y & - & z & + & 3w & = & -1
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: Infinitely many, depending on one parameter
answer2: Infinitely many, depending on two parameters
